title: Blind Developers Launch Open Source AI Agent Teams to Fix Accessibility Gap in AI Coding Tools
summary: Community Access announces the public launch of Accessibility Agents -- 47 specialized AI agents, 14 knowledge modules, and 52 pre-built prompts across Claude Code, GitHub Copilot, and Claude Desktop.

title: New WCAG Audit Tool Reaches 1,000 Scans in First Week
summary: The web accessibility wizard agent has completed over 1,000 automated WCAG 2.2 AA audits since launch, identifying more than 8,000 individual findings across community projects.

title: Accessibility Agents Now Available for GitHub Copilot
summary: Community Access expands platform support with 52 pre-built prompts for GitHub Copilot, bringing automated accessibility review to millions of developers already using Copilot.

title: Document Accessibility Wizard Ships with Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and PDF Support
summary: The new document accessibility wizard can audit Office documents and PDFs for accessibility compliance, covering heading structure, alt text, table headers, and reading order.

title: Community Access Reaches 500 GitHub Stars
summary: The Community Access organization crosses 500 stars on GitHub as more developers discover the open source accessibility agents project.

title: Contrast Master Agent Catches Color Failures Before They Ship
summary: The contrast-master agent now validates color tokens in design systems including Tailwind, MUI, Chakra UI, and Style Dictionary configurations at the source level.

title: Keyboard Navigator Agent Adds Focus Trap Detection
summary: The keyboard-navigator agent can now detect and flag focus traps, missing skip links, and broken tab order in single-page applications automatically.

title: Mobile Accessibility Agent Launches for React Native and SwiftUI
summary: A new mobile accessibility specialist agent reviews React Native, Expo, SwiftUI, and UIKit code for touch target sizes, screen reader labels, and platform-specific semantics.

title: ePub Accessibility Scanning Now Available
summary: Community Access adds ePub document scanning with EPUB Accessibility 1.1 conformance checks including navigation, reading order, alt text, and accessibility metadata.

title: Community Access Goes Open Source
summary: Taylor Arndt and Michael Babcock open source the accessibility agents project under the MIT license, making the full agent suite freely available to all developers.

title: First External Contributors Join the Project
summary: Community Access welcomes its first wave of external contributors, with pull requests improving ARIA patterns, form validation, and dark mode contrast checks.

title: Early Preview of Accessibility Agents Available for Testing
summary: An early preview build of the accessibility agents is now available for developers who want to test automated WCAG audits in their Claude Code workflows.

title: Announcing Community Access: AI-Powered Accessibility for Everyone
summary: Two blind developers announce Community Access, a new open source project building AI agent teams that make accessibility the default in software development.
